techmeme.title: Epic launches a rival app store for iOS in the EU, offering its games, including Fortnite, and plans to start onboarding third-party devs' games from December (Morgan Meaker/Wired)
EQT agrees to buy PropertyGuru, which runs real estate rental and sale listing sites in SE Asia, for $1.1B in cash; the deal is expected to close by early 2025 (Will Davies/Bloomberg)
Chinese chip equipment maker AMEC sues the Pentagon for linking AMEC to the Chinese military, seeks to get off a blacklist that bars business with US firms (Bloomberg)
Revolut secures a $45B valuation, up from $33B during a 2021 fundraising, in a share sale by employees; the sale was led by Coatue and D1 Capital Partners (Akila Quinio/Financial Times)
The Biden administration approves $1.6B in Chips Act grants and $3B in loans for Texas Instruments, to support its one chip factory in Utah and two in Texas (Mackenzie Hawkins/Bloomberg)
